description: A comprehensive catalog of automobile specifications containing detailed technical information about various car models including performance metrics, pricing, and physical characteristics. This table serves as a central repository for car data that can be used for comparison, analysis, and reference purposes in automotive applications.

columns.description: Unique identifier for each car record in the database. This primary key ensures each car entry can be distinctly referenced and serves as the main indexing column for the table.
The manufacturer or brand name of the automobile (e.g., Toyota, BMW, Ford). This field identifies which company produced the vehicle and is essential for brand-based filtering and analysis.
The specific model name or designation of the vehicle (e.g., Camry, X5, Mustang). This field works in conjunction with Company Names to provide complete vehicle identification.

Engine type and configuration details such as engine layout, number of cylinders, or engine technology (e.g., V6, I4 Turbo, Hybrid). This technical specification is crucial for performance analysis and comparison.

Engine displacement in cubic centimeters (CC) for combustion engines or battery capacity for electric vehicles. This dual-purpose field accommodates both traditional and electric vehicle specifications, indicating the power source capacity.
The maximum power output of the vehicle's engine measured in horsepower (HP). This metric is fundamental for assessing vehicle performance capabilities and comparing power across different models.

Maximum achievable speed of the vehicle, typically measured in kilometers per hour (KM/H) or miles per hour (MPH). This specification indicates the vehicle's top speed capability under optimal conditions.

Acceleration performance measured as the time required to accelerate from 0 to 100 kilometers per hour, typically expressed in seconds. This is a standard benchmark for evaluating vehicle acceleration performance.

The market price or retail cost of the vehicle, which may include currency symbols and formatting. This financial information is essential for cost analysis, budgeting, and market comparison purposes.

Type of fuel or energy source used by the vehicle (e.g., Gasoline, Diesel, Electric, Hybrid, Plug-in Hybrid). This specification is crucial for environmental impact assessment and operational cost calculations.

Number of passenger seats available in the vehicle, indicating the seating capacity. This practical specification helps determine the vehicle's suitability for different family sizes and passenger requirements.

Engine torque output, typically measured in Newton-meters (Nm) or pound-feet (lb-ft). This measurement indicates the rotational force produced by the engine and is important for assessing pulling power and acceleration characteristics.

description: ICRISAT agricultural statistics dataset containing comprehensive crop production data for different states and districts across India over multiple years. This table includes area, production, and yield metrics for major crops including cereals (rice, wheat, sorghum, millet, maize), pulses (chickpea, pigeonpea), oilseeds, and commercial crops, organized by geographical location and year for agricultural analysis and research.

columns.description: Primary key - unique identifier for each record in the ICRISAT dataset
District code - numeric identifier for the district where agricultural data was collected
Calendar year when the agricultural production data was recorded
State code - numeric identifier for the Indian state where agricultural data was collected
Name of the Indian state where the agricultural production data was recorded
Name of the district within the state where agricultural production data was recorded
Area under rice cultivation in thousands of hectares for the given district and year
Rice production in thousands of tons for the given district and year
Rice yield in kilograms per hectare for the given district and year
Area under wheat cultivation in thousands of hectares for the given district and year
Wheat production in thousands of tons for the given district and year
Wheat yield in kilograms per hectare for the given district and year

Kharif season sorghum yield in kilograms per hectare for the given district and year

Rabi season sorghum yield in kilograms per hectare for the given district and year

Total sorghum production (combined Kharif and Rabi seasons) in thousands of tons for the given district and year
Total sorghum yield (combined Kharif and Rabi seasons) in kilograms per hectare for the given district and year

description: This table stores user ratings for movies, serving as a junction table that connects users to movies with their corresponding rating values and timestamps. It enables tracking of user preferences and movie popularity over time.

columns.description: Primary key identifier for each unique rating record
Identifier of the user who submitted the rating, allowing null values for anonymous ratings
Foreign key referencing movies.movie_id, identifying which movie was rated
Numerical rating value given by the user for the movie, stored as a double precision decimal
Unix timestamp indicating when the rating was submitted, enabling temporal analysis of ratings

description: A comprehensive water bodies inventory table that stores detailed information about various water storage facilities across India, including their location, physical characteristics, ownership, usage status, and management details. This table appears to be part of a national water bodies census or inventory system, capturing data about tanks, ponds, lakes, and other water storage structures across rural and urban areas.

columns.description: Primary key identifier for each water body record in the system
Classification indicating whether the water body is located in a rural or urban area
Name of the state where the water body is located
Name of the district within the state where the water body is situated
Administrative subdivision name (block or tehsil) where the water body is located
Name of the village where the water body is located (applicable for rural areas)
Name of the town or municipality where the water body is located (applicable for urban areas)
Name of the administrative ward within a town or municipality where the water body is situated
Serial number or sequence identifier of the water body within a specific village or town
Unique identifier code assigned to each water body for tracking and reference purposes
Local or official name of the water body (tank, pond, lake, etc.)
Name of the river basin or major hydrological basin to which the water body belongs
Name of the sub-basin within the larger basin system where the water body is located
Classification or type of the water body (e.g., tank, pond, lake, reservoir) from a reference lookup
Type of water storage mechanism or structure (e.g., surface storage, check dam)
Land survey number or plot identification number where the water body is located
Geographical latitude coordinate of the water body in decimal degrees
Geographical longitude coordinate of the water body in decimal degrees
Descriptive location name or landmark reference for the water body
Type of ownership of the water body (e.g., government, private, community)
Current usage status of the water body (e.g., in use, not in use) from a reference lookup
Primary reason for the current usage status of the water body from a reference lookup
Cultural Command Area of the water body, indicating the area that can be irrigated
Irrigation Potential Created by the water body, measuring its irrigation capacity
Status and reason related to any development or revival scheme for the water body
Natural characteristics or origin of the water body (e.g., natural, man-made)
Specific type or classification of man-made water body if applicable
Year when the water body was originally constructed (note: contains spelling error in column name)
Total cost incurred during the original construction of the water body
Most recent year when the water body underwent renovation or major repairs
Cost incurred during the most recent renovation or repair work
Current status indicating if the water body is under repair, renovation, or restoration from a reference lookup
Status indicator of whether any revival scheme for the water body has been completed
Year when the water body was included in a development or revival scheme
Target year for completion of ongoing or planned development schemes
Estimated cost for planned or ongoing development/revival schemes
Target irrigation potential that is expected to be revived through development schemes
Actual irrigation potential that has been successfully revived or restored
Surface area covered by water when the water body is at full capacity
Maximum depth of the water body when it is completely filled with water
Original designed storage capacity of the water body at the time of construction
Current actual storage capacity of the water body, which may be different from original due to siltation or other factors
Classification or status of how much the storage capacity is currently filled
Description of the current water level or storage space utilization status
Number of towns or cities that benefit from this water body for various purposes
Number of villages that benefit from this water body for irrigation, drinking water, or other purposes
Total number of people who benefit directly or indirectly from this water body
Indicates whether a Water User Association (WUA) exists for managing this water body from a reference lookup
Area extent covered by the Water User Association for management purposes
Number of Water User Associations formed for managing this water body
Indicates whether Detailed Project Report (DPR) or Special Investment Plan (SIP) exists for this water body from a reference lookup
Indicates whether the water body is encroached upon by unauthorized activities from a reference lookup
Indicates whether encroachment assessment has been conducted for this water body from a reference lookup
Percentage of the water body area that has been encroached upon
Secondary reason for the current usage status of the water body
Tertiary reason for the current usage status of the water body

description: A table storing movie information including titles and genre classifications. This table serves as a core entity in a movie database system and likely has relationships with other tables such as ratings, actors, or directors through the movie_id primary key.

columns.description: Unique identifier for each movie. This serves as the primary key and is used to establish relationships with other tables in the database such as ratings, cast, or crew information.
The official title or name of the movie. This field can be null, though it would be unusual for a movie record to exist without a title.

The genre classification(s) for the movie, such as 'Action', 'Comedy', 'Drama', etc. This field may contain multiple genres separated by a delimiter (like pipe '|' or comma) or stored as a single genre string. Can be null if genre information is not available.

description: A bridge table that connects movies in the local database to their corresponding entries in external movie databases (IMDb and TMDb). This table enables cross-referencing and data enrichment by linking local movie records with their external database identifiers.

columns.description: Foreign key referencing movies.movie_id. Uniquely identifies a movie in the local database that has corresponding entries in external movie databases.

The Internet Movie Database (IMDb) identifier for the movie. This is typically a string in the format 'tt' followed by numbers (e.g., 'tt0111161'). Can be null if the movie doesn't have an IMDb entry or if the ID is unknown.

The Movie Database (TMDb) identifier for the movie. This is a numeric ID used by TMDb to uniquely identify movies in their database. Can be null if the movie doesn't have a TMDb entry or if the ID is unknown.

description: This table stores user-generated tags for movies, allowing users to add descriptive keywords or labels to movies. It serves as a many-to-many relationship between users and movies, enabling personalized movie tagging and metadata enrichment. The table connects to the movies table through the movie_id foreign key relationship.

columns.description: Identifier for the user who created the tag. References the user who applied this specific tag to a movie.
Foreign key referencing movies.movie_id. Identifies which movie this tag was applied to.
The actual tag text/keyword applied by the user to describe or categorize the movie. Can be any descriptive word or phrase.
Unix timestamp indicating when the tag was created or applied to the movie by the user.
